attributes.action: Bring the age for a bus pass in all of England to 60, in line with London
attributes.additional_details:
It is unfair and inexplicable that the people who live in England (excluding London) have to wait until state retirement age to benefit from a bus pass while the rest of the UK get one at age 60.
Surely as we try to decrease our emissions in this country it is a positive move to encourage the use of public transport wherever  possible
attributes.background: In London, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland people receive a bus pass at age 60 yet everywhere else in England it is state retirement age. Please change this to 60 for all of the UK.
